explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

self_heating_substances.rationale: The test method applicable for substances becoming liquid or gas at 140degC of test temperature has not been established.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At) are not included.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: It is an organic compound not containing oxygen, fluorine or chlorine.

organic_peroxides.rationale: The organic compound not including peroxy group in molecule.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: From a description of LD50 value of 1,000 mg/kg (IUCLID (2000), HSDB (2005)) in the oral administration test employing rats, it was classified into Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Since LD50 value of the dermal administration test employing rats was >5,000 mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)), it was classified into "Not classified".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Since it was a solid by the definition of GHS and inhalation in gas was not assumed, it was classified into "Not applicable".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Although there is a description of "not irritating" (IUCLID (2000)) in the eye irritation test employing rabbits (OECD TG405), since it is a non-GLP test and there is no other data, classification is not possible.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Classification is not possible since there is no data.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Although there is a description of "not sensitizing" in the Maximization test employing guinea pig (IUCLID (2000)), classification is not possible because of unknown OECD TG conformity, non-GLP test, and no other data.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Classification is not possible because there is no data of in vivo examination.In addition, there are descriptions of "negative" in the HGPRT tests employing the CHO culture cells (IUCLID (2000)) and "positive" in the Ames test employing a Salmonella typhimurium as in vitro examinations (IUCLID (2000)).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since no evaluation by major international evaluation agencies is made and there is no data, classification is not possible.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (nervous system, systemic toxicity)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: The test employing rabbits has a description of "reduction of central nervous system control, a tactile sense, and algesia susceptibility, internal-organs congestion, accumulation of fluid in the lungs, localized hemorrhages of gastric mucous membrane, and description of bowel swelling" (HSDB (2005)), and since these were seen within the limits of the guidance value of Category 1 or Category 2, they were taken as Category 1/2 (nervous systems, systemic toxicity).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (nervous system, systemic toxicity)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the report that "myasthenia, changes in blood morphology and the nervous and cardiovascular systems were observed at a dose of 100 mg/kg" (HSDB (2005)) in a 15-week study with rabbits, it was classified as Category 2 (nervous system, systemic toxicity).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.052mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (AQUIRE (2008)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since acute toxicity was Category 1 and there were no rapid degradability (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.
